summary_reasoning: The report states several core valuation drivers explicitly and near the forecasts (revenue CAGR 7–8% FY26–29, non-GAAP operating margin 34–35%, WACC 9%, terminal growth 2.5%, tax rate 25%, FCF conversion 30–32%, share count modestly declining). Specificity is generally solid with units and time horizons. Justification is partial: revenue growth is tied to management guidance and product traction; margins to scale and efficiency; WACC components are listed but lack sourcing; terminal growth and tax rate are asserted without evidence or peer/context benchmarks. Internal consistency has material issues: FCF conversion in the Financials Snapshot implies ~34% in FY26–29 versus the text’s 30–32% and the Appendix’s “~30%,” and the implied EV/Sales at fair value is given as both ~7.5× (Analyst Note) and ~7.8× (Fair Value section). Sensitivity analysis is minimal and generic (“a 1% error… alters value by mid-single digit percentage”), with no scenario bands for key levers (revenue growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth). Due to multiple unresolved numeric contradictions and limited sensitivities, the quality of assumptions does not meet Good standards despite reasonable explicitness and specificity.

assumptions_extracted.quote: we assume FY26–29 revenue growth of ~7–8% annually
We project non-GAAP operating margins rising to ~34–35% by FY26–29 (up from 33.0% in FY25)
We assume a 9.0% WACC (implied beta ~1.1, ERP ~5%)
Free cash flow conversion remains high (we model ~30–32% of revenue)

contradictions.description: FCF conversion modeled at ~30–32% (and Appendix ~30%) conflicts with implied conversion from table (~34% in FY26–29).
Implied EV/Sales at fair value shown as ~7.5× vs ~7.8× in different sections.

unjustified_parameters: Terminal growth 2.5% without source/peer or macro tie-in
FCF conversion 30–32% without reconciliation to table or drivers (capex/working capital)
